meanings.definition: To be left without parents or guardians.
meanings.sent1: The little kitten was orphaned when its mother passed away.
meanings.sent2: The young boy was orphaned after a tragic accident took both his parents.
meanings.sent3: The lost puppy was orphaned and had to find a new family to take care of it.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned duckling felt orphaned without its siblings by its side.
meanings.sent5: The baby bird was orphaned and had to learn to fly on its own.

meanings.sent1: The orphaned child wandered the streets alone, looking for food.
meanings.sent2: The orphaned puppy was taken in by a kind family who gave it a loving home.
meanings.sent3: The orphaned teddy bear sat on the shelf, waiting for someone to play with it.
meanings.sent4: The orphaned plant struggled to grow without enough sunlight and water.
meanings.sent5: The orphaned book sat on the shelf, collecting dust and longing to be read.
